Chevron provides administrative, financial, management and technology support to U.S. and international subsidiaries that engage in integrated energy and chemicals operations . Downstream operations consist of refining crude oil into petroleum products; marketing of crude oil, refined products and lubricants; manufacturing and marketing of renewable fuels; transporting crude oil and refined products by pipeline, marine vessel, motor equipment and rail car .
 Strong competition exists in all sectors of the petroleum and petrochemical industries in supplying the energy, fuel and chemical needs of industry and individual consumers . Laws and governmental policies, particularly in the areas of taxation, energy and the environment, affect where and how companies invest, conduct their operations, select feedstocks, and formulate their products .
 The term “Chevron” may refer to Chevron Corporation, one or more of its consolidated subsidiaries, or all of them taken as a whole . Information about the company is available on the company’s website at www.chevron.com . The company was founded in 1926 as Standard Oil Company of California .
 The Chevron Way explains the company’s beliefs, vision, purpose and values . Chevron leadership is accountable for investing in the company's people and culture . This includes reviews of critical function hiring, leadership development, retention, diversity and inclusion, and employee engagement . The reports are furnished to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)
 Chevron’s philosophy is to offer compelling career opportunities and a competitive total compensation and benefits package linked to individual and enterprise performance . Chevron invests in developing leadership at every level, including coaching programs for frontline supervisors, managers and individual contributors . The voluntary attrition for this population in 2024 was 3.1 perc .
 Chevron believes its low voluntary attrition rate is in part a result of the company’s commitment to employee development, competitive pay and benefits . The company has 11 employee networks (voluntary groups open to all employees with shared interests) Chevron rejects the use of quotas and focuses on removing barriers to equal opportunity, fostering diversity, and ensuring that selection decisions are based on merit .
 The company has set clear expectations for leaders to deliver operational excellence by prioritizing the safety and health of its workforce, and the protection of communities, the environment and the company’s assets . The upstream and downstream activities of the company and its equity affiliates are widely dispersed geographically . The company offers long-standing employee support programs such as Ombuds, an independent resource designed to equip employees with options to address and resolve workplace issues .
 The company’s proved reserves at year-end 2024 were approximately 9.8 billion barrels of oil-equivalent (BOE) The company recognizes reserves for projects with various development periods, sometimes exceeding five years . At December 31, 2024, 41 percent of the company's net proved proved reserves were located in the United States, 16 percent in Australia and 13 percent in Kazakhstan .

 The company estimates its average worldwide oil-equivalent production in 2025 to increase six to eight percent over 2024 .  Oil-equivalent conversion ratio is 6,000 cubic feet of natural gas = 1 barrel of crude oil . Total natural gas volumes were 7,569 million and 7,148 million cubic feet per day in 2024 and 2023 .
 The company sells crude oil, natural gas, and NGLs from its producing operations under a variety of contractual obligations . Most contracts generally commit the company to sell quantities based on production from specified properties . The company believes it can satisfy these contracts through a combination of equity production from the company’s proved developed U.S. reserves and third party purchases .
 A “development well” is a well drilled within the known area of a crude oil or natural gas reservoir to the depth of a stratigraphic horizon known to be productive .  Chevron continues to develop its advantaged portfolio of 1,780,000 net acres in the Delaware and Midland basins in west Texas and southeast New Mexico . The company has implemented a factory development strategy utilizing multi-well pads to drill a series of horizontal wells that are subsequently completed using hydraulic fracture stimulation . Chevron’s 2024 net daily production in the Permian Basin averaged 405,000 barrels of crude oil, 251,000 barrel of NGLs and 1.6 billion cubi .
 Chevron is the largest oil and natural gas producer in Colorado . Chevron follows a factory development strategy utilizing multi-well pads to drill a series of horizontal wells that are subsequently completed using hydraulic fracture stimulation . Chevron also has operations in Colorado’s Piceance Basin, as well as an acreage position in Wyoming .
 Chevron has a 62.9 percent-owned and operated interest in the unit areas containing the Anchor Field, located in the Green Canyon area . The Anchor development consists of a seven-well subsea development and a semi-submersible floating production unit achieved first oil in August 2024 . The field has an estimated remaining production life of 30 years .
 The Tahiti Field surpassed 500 million barrels of oil-equivalent cumulative production in 2024 and has an estimated remaining production life of 20 years . The Jack/St. Malo Stage 5 project reached final investment decision (FID), with first oil expected in 2026 . Chevron has a 15.6 percent working interest in the deepwater Mad Dog Field, located in the Green Canyon area .
 The company has a 40 percent working interest in the Whale discovery located in the Alaminos Canyon area . Chevron has a 50 percent interest in Bayou Bend, a carbon dioxide transportation and sequestration affiliate that holds approximately 140,000 acres for carbon dioxide storage . The Whale consists of a fifteen-well subsea development and floating production unit .
 Chevron owns and operates a 100 percent interest in the El Trapial Field with conventional waterflood . The conventional field concession expires in 2032 . Chevron has a 14% interest in a pipeline system that provides an important export route for Argentina’s crude oil . The company also has interests in the Northeast British Columbia and the Beaufort Sea region of the Northwest Territories .
 Chevron’s interests in Venezuela are located in western Venezuela, the Orinoco Belt and offshore Venezuela . Chevron has a 40 percent-owned and operated interest in the offshore Colombia-3 Block . Chevron also has a 30 percent interest in Petropiar, which operates the heavy oil Huyapari Field under an agreement expiring in 2047 .
 The company is engaged in upstream activities in Angola, Cameroon, Egypt, Equatorial Guinea, Namibia and Nigeria . Chevron has a 36.4 percent shareholding in Angola LNG Limited, which operates an onshore natural gas liquefaction plant in Soyo, Angola. The plant has the capacity to process 1.1 billion cubic feet of natural gas per day .
 Chevron operates and holds a 15.5 percent interest in the Lianzi Unitization Zone (Lianzi), which is located in an area shared equally by Angola and the ROC . Chevron has interests in Egypt blocks in both the Mediterranean and Red Sea . In the Mediterranean Sea, Chevron holds a 63.63 percent-owned and operated interest in North El Dabaa (Block 4) and 45 percent owned and operated interests in Nargis Block .
 Chevron has 40 percent interests in concessions across the onshore and shallow-offshore regions of the Niger Delta . The company also holds acreage positions in five operated and six nonoperated deepwater blocks . Chevron has an 80 percent-owned and operated interest in Petroleum Exploration License (PEL) 90 (Block 2813B) in the Orange Basin, offshore Namibia .
 Chevron operates and holds a 55 percent working interest in the Nsiko discovery in OML 140 . Chevron also holds a 30 percent nonoperated working interest . Chevron discovered new oil in the Niger Delta at Petroleum Mining Lease 49 (previously within OML 90) in 2024 . The Meji NW-1 discovery is expected to increase Chevron’s oil production in the joint venture .
 The company is engaged in upstream activities in Bangladesh, China, Cyprus, Indonesia, Israel, Kazakhstan, the Partitioned Zone between Saudi Arabia and Kuwait, Russia and Thailand . In addition, the company holds a 36.9 percent interest in the West African Gas Pipeline Company Limited affiliate, which supplies Nigerian natural gas to customers in Benin, Togo and Ghana .
 Chevron is undergoing front end engineering design (FEED) and procurement for long lead items to further expand the installed capacity at the Leviathan Field from 1.4 to up to 2.1 billion cubic feet per day . The company also holds a 25 percent-owned and operated interest in the Tamar gas field, which operates under a concession that expires in 2038 .
 Most of TCO’s 2024 crude oil production was exported through the Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC) pipeline . TCO reached FID on Phase 2 of the Tamar Optimization Project in February 2024, which is expected to further increase capacity up to approximately 1.6 billion cubic feet of gas per day . The Karachaganak field is located in northwest Kazakhstan, and operations are conducted under a PSA that expires in 2038 .
 Chevron withdrew from Myanmar, effective April 2024 . Chevron has operated interests in the Pattani Basin, located in the Gulf of Thailand, with ownership ranging from 35 percent to 71.2 percent . Chevron also has an exploration and production license for Block G2/65, which covers 3.7 million net acres . The NWWB-1 exploration well reached total depth and was placed on production in 2024 .
 The company is the operator of two major LNG projects, Gorgon and Wheatstone . It has a nonoperated working interest in the North West Shelf (NWS) Venture and exploration acreage in the Carnarvon Basin . The company has an 80.2 percent interest in offshore licenses and a 64.1 percent-owned and operated interest in LNG facilities .
 Chevron owns and operates the Clio, Acme and Acme West fields in the Carnarvon Basin off the northwestern coast of Western Australia . The company continues to evaluate exploration and appraisal activity across the region . Chevron holds operated and nonoperated working interests ranging from 20 to 70 percent in five greenhouse gas assessment permits to evaluate potential of carbon dioxide storage .
 The Clair Field has an estimated remaining production life extending beyond 2050 . U.S. and international sales of natural gas averaged 5.2 billion and 5.7 billion cubic feet per day in 2024 . Outside the United States, substantially all of the natural gas sales from the company’s producing interests are from operations in Angola, Australia, Bangladesh, Canada, Equatorial Guinea, Kazakhstan, Israel, Nigeria and Thailand .
 Chevron processes both imported and domestic crude oil in its U.S. refining operations . The company has interests in three large refineries in Singapore, South Korea and Thailand . In 2024, the company completed the upgrade of the Pasadena Refinery, which is expected to increase light crude oil throughput capacity to 125,000 barrels per day .
 The company develops and produces renewable fuels, including renewable diesel, renewable gasoline, biodiesel, sustainable aviation fuel and renewable natural gas (RNG) Chevron owns and operates 11 biofuel refineries located in the U.S. and Germany . The company holds a 50 percent working interest in Bunge Chevron Ag Renewables LLC, which produces soybean oil from processing facilities in Destrehan, Louisiana, and Cairo, Illinois . Soybean oil can be used as a renewable feedstock to make renewable diesel .
 In 2024, Brightmark announced the inauguration of its Eloy Renewable Natural Gas center in Arizona and achieved commercial operations at ten additional projects across Iowa, Michigan, Ohio, South Dakota and Wisconsin . The company markets petroleum products under the principal brands of “Chevron,” “Texaco” and “Caltex” throughout many parts of the world .
 The company markets primarily under the principal brands of “Chevron” and “Texaco .” At year-end 2024, the company supplied directly or through retailers and marketers approximately 8,500 Chevron- and Texaco-branded service stations . The rebranding project to transition service stations in Australia from Puma to the Caltex brand is expected to complete in 2025 .
 At the end of 2024, CPChem owned or had joint-venture interests in 30 manufacturing facilities and two research and development centers around the world . Chevron owns and operates a network of crude oil, natural gas and product pipelines in the United States . The company also has direct and indirect interests in other U.S. and international pipelines .
 Chevron's marine fleet includes both U.S. and foreign flagged vessels . The operated fleet consists of conventional crude tankers, product carriers and LNG vessels . Chevron Technical Center conducts research, develops and qualifies technology and provides technical services and competency development in support of business outcomes . In 2024, Chevron announced the establishment of an engineering and innovation center in India to provide technical and digital solutions for the enterprise .
 Chevron leverages its in-house expertise to undertake internal research and development to advance energy solutions . The company holds more than 4,000 patents for new technologies, with nearly 3,400 additional patents pending . Chevron is applying artificial intelligence (AI) to drive productivity, efficiency and value to its global operations. The company is building high-impact use cases leveraging its extensive data and insights to access AI solutions to help unlock value .
 Chevron also makes investments indirectly through the following funds: the Oil and Gas Climate Initiative (OGCI) Climate Investments’ Catalyst Fund I, which targets decarbonization within the oil and gas, industrial, built environments and commercial transportation sectors . Some of the investments the company makes in the areas described above are in new or unproven technologies and business processes .
 Chevron requires its facilities and operations to have operating standards and processes and emergency response plans . Chevron maintains active membership in international oil spill response cooperatives, including the Marine Spill Response Corporation . The company aims to lower the carbon intensity of its oil and gas operations and comply with the related laws and regulations to which it is subject .
